title: The colorful mage is a peacock?

embed.description: We've hit our 100th edition of Ask Riot, a series where we answer player questions from all over the world. This time, we brought in the experts to tackle our backlog of the most vexing questions. The leads on the gameplay, champion, and personalization teams join forces to finally provide answers for you.

replies.body:
It's not a peacock. You're delusional. A couple of reasons:

1. The last Vastayans were Rakan and Xayah, both bird people. It'd get way repetitive if a new Vastaya was also a bird person, especially a bombastic, colorful bird like a peacock. It'd overlap Rakan too much.
2. Notable in just about every mention of the colorful mage in the Roadmap months ago was the words "HIDDEN" and "HIDING." Peacocks don't hide. They're in your face, gorgeous birds.

There is ONE animal that fits this bill. There is a colorful - more specifically, a color changing - animal that uses this talent to hide. A chameleon.

I hardly think creativity has anything to do with it. In fact, it's the LACK of creativity. It's not about them looking like a specific bird person, it's about them not looking like a bird person at all.

They look like a generic fantasy race found in a Korean mmorpg, but that's a discussion for another time.

That is a bit different from "generic bird-person", one race in one game is not the same as every other bird-person everywhere else, or even similar. Would you have preferred it if they were more like the Aarakocra from D&D? Or perhaps had more than one "wing"? Perhaps more plumage? I don't really like the champions either, but when you don't explain why you dislike them there are bound to be misunderstandings.

I feel no point explaining what Riot isn't going to listen to anyway. But I'll explain.

There's four ways to go with a bird person character.

1) Human who turns into a bird. Kinda like Swain before the rework that ruined him.

2) Humanoid bird, half-bird half-human. Like that race from Starbound.

3) Human who is human but has a distinct bird feel to the movements, look and personality. Taliyah actually does that! She's a sparrow-themed human.

4) Humanoid bird, who looks mostly human. Riot has tried to do that with Xayah and Rakan. But failed. To make them feel like birds, they have to engage in a behaviour that reminds us of birds, or they have to look like recognizable birds. But Xayah and Rakan don't do that, even in spite of their bird legs. They don't feel like birds. Taliyah feels more like one, and she's human, and birds aren't even her main theme.
